Implementation details:
- Created `src/lib/hooks/useStockData.ts` with full SWR integration
- Main useStockData hook features:
  - 24-hour data caching (dedupingInterval: 24h)
  - Automatic revalidation on window focus
  - Disabled revalidation on reconnect (relies on cache)
  - Smart retry logic with exponential backoff (3 retries: 1s, 2s, 4s)
  - Conditional retry based on error type (no retry for invalid symbols/API errors)

  - shouldRetryOnError logic based on error.canRetry flag
  - Fallback error handling for unexpected error types
- Cache key generation:

  - Prefixed keys (stock-data:SYMBOL) for cache organization
- Additional utility hooks:
  - useMultipleStockData for fetching multiple symbols simultaneously
  - preloadStockData for hover-based preloading
  - invalidateStockData for manual cache invalidation
- TypeScript integration:
  - Full typing with UseStockDataReturn interface
  - Proper SWR generic typing for data and error states
  - Optional configuration parameters with defaults
- No linting errors and follows React hooks rules
- Ready for integration with watch-list components

tasks.title: Implement Encryption/Decryption API Routes
tasks.description: Create secure API endpoints for encrypting and decrypting user data using AES-256-GCM
tasks.details:
1. Create `app/api/encrypt/route.ts` with:
   - POST handler accepting JSON state data
   - AES-256-GCM encryption using Node.js crypto module
   - 32-byte key from `ENCRYPTION_KEY` environment variable
   - Return encrypted blob as application/octet-stream
   - 200KB payload size limit
   - 3-second maxDuration
2. Create `app/api/decrypt/route.ts` with:
   - POST handler accepting encrypted file data
   - Decrypt and return plain JSON
   - Proper error handling for malformed data
3. Create `lib/crypto.ts` utility functions
4. Add proper TypeScript types for API responses
5. Implement comprehensive error handling and validation
tasks.testStrategy: Test encryption/decryption roundtrip, verify file size limits, test malformed data handling, ensure environment key security

subtasks.title: Create AES-256-GCM Encryption API Route
subtasks.description: Implement the POST handler in `app/api/encrypt/route.ts` that accepts JSON state data, encrypts it using AES-256-GCM with a 32-byte key from the `ENCRYPTION_KEY` environment variable, and returns the encrypted blob as application/octet-stream. Enforce a 200KB payload size limit and a 3-second maximum duration for processing.
subtasks.details: Use Node.js crypto module for AES-256-GCM encryption. Generate a 12-byte IV (nonce) as per AES-GCM standard. Ensure proper error handling for invalid input and environment key issues.

subtasks.title: Create AES-256-GCM Decryption API Route
subtasks.description: Implement the POST handler in `app/api/decrypt/route.ts` that accepts encrypted file data, decrypts it using AES-256-GCM with the same 32-byte key, and returns the decrypted JSON data. Include robust error handling for malformed or invalid encrypted data.
subtasks.details: Use Node.js crypto module for decryption. Validate input format and handle authentication tag verification failures gracefully. Return appropriate HTTP error codes for decryption errors.

subtasks.title: Develop Crypto Utility Functions
subtasks.description: Create reusable utility functions for AES-256-GCM encryption and decryption to be used by both API routes. Include functions for key retrieval, IV generation, encryption, decryption, and authentication tag handling.
subtasks.details: Ensure utilities enforce 12-byte IV size for compatibility and security. Include input validation and error propagation. Abstract environment variable access for the encryption key.

subtasks.title: Add TypeScript Typings for API and Crypto Utilities
subtasks.description: Define comprehensive TypeScript interfaces and types for API request and response payloads, crypto utility function parameters and return types, and error objects to ensure type safety and developer clarity.
subtasks.details: Include types for JSON state data, encrypted binary data, error responses, and environment configuration. Use strict typing to prevent runtime errors and improve maintainability.

subtasks.title: Implement Comprehensive Error Handling and Validation
subtasks.description: Integrate thorough validation of inputs, payload sizes, and environment variables in both API routes and crypto utilities. Implement detailed error handling to catch and respond to malformed data, decryption failures, missing keys, and timeout breaches.
subtasks.details: Return meaningful HTTP status codes and error messages. Log errors securely without exposing sensitive data. Enforce the 200KB payload size and 3-second maxDuration constraints with appropriate error responses.

subtasks.title: Implement Security Measures for Authentication

tasks.title: Implement Accessibility and Responsive Design
tasks.description: Ensure WCAG 2.2 AA compliance and responsive design across all breakpoints
tasks.details:
1. Implement keyboard navigation for all interactive elements
2. Add proper ARIA labels and roles
3. Ensure color contrast meets WCAG 2.2 AA standards
4. Test with screen readers (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver)
5. Implement focus management and skip links
6. Optimize for breakpoints: 375px, 768px, 1280px
7. Test touch interactions on mobile devices
8. Add proper heading hierarchy (h1-h6)
9. Ensure charts are keyboard navigable
10. Add alt text for all images and icons
11. Test with accessibility tools (axe, Lighthouse)
tasks.testStrategy: Automated accessibility testing with axe-core, manual testing with screen readers, keyboard-only navigation testing, responsive design testing across devices

subtasks.title: Implement Keyboard Navigation
subtasks.description: Ensure all interactive elements are fully operable using keyboard-only input, including tab order and keyboard shortcuts.
subtasks.details: Test tabbing through all interactive components, ensure focus is visible and logical, and support keyboard activation for all controls.

subtasks.title: Add ARIA Labels and Roles
subtasks.description: Apply appropriate ARIA roles, states, and properties to UI elements to improve accessibility for assistive technologies.
subtasks.details: Use ARIA roles to define element types, add labels for unlabeled controls, and ensure dynamic content updates are announced.

subtasks.title: Ensure Color Contrast Compliance
subtasks.description: Verify that text and UI elements meet WCAG 2.2 AA minimum contrast ratios for readability.
subtasks.details: Check color contrast ratios for text, icons, and graphical elements using automated tools and manual verification.

subtasks.title: Conduct Screen Reader Testing
subtasks.description: Test the application with popular screen readers such as NVDA, JAWS, and VoiceOver to ensure content is properly announced.
subtasks.details: Verify that all interactive elements, status messages, and dynamic content are accessible and understandable via screen readers.

subtasks.title: Implement Focus Management and Skip Links
subtasks.description: Manage keyboard focus order and provide skip links to improve navigation efficiency for keyboard and screen reader users.
subtasks.details: Ensure focus is not trapped, visible, and moves logically; add skip navigation links to bypass repetitive content.

subtasks.title: Optimize Responsive Design for Breakpoints
subtasks.description: Ensure the UI adapts correctly and remains accessible at key breakpoints: 375px, 768px, and 1280px widths.
subtasks.details: Test layout, font sizes, touch targets, and navigation at each breakpoint to maintain usability and accessibility.

subtasks.title: Test Touch Interaction on Mobile Devices
subtasks.description: Verify that all interactive elements are operable via touch input and meet minimum target size requirements.
subtasks.details: Check touch target sizes (minimum 24x24 CSS pixels), gesture alternatives, and responsiveness on various mobile devices.

subtasks.title: Establish Proper Heading Hierarchy
subtasks.description: Use semantic heading tags (h1-h6) to create a logical and accessible document structure.
subtasks.details: Ensure headings are nested correctly without skipping levels and reflect the content hierarchy for screen reader users.

subtasks.title: Ensure Chart Accessibility
subtasks.description: Make charts keyboard navigable and provide accessible descriptions for data visualization.
subtasks.details: Add keyboard focus support, ARIA roles, and descriptive text or long descriptions for charts and graphs.

subtasks.title: Add Alt Text for Images and Icons
subtasks.description: Provide meaningful alternative text for all images and icons to support screen reader users.
subtasks.details: Use concise alt attributes for decorative and functional images; provide extended descriptions for complex visuals.

subtasks.title: Perform Accessibility Tool Testing
subtasks.description: Run automated accessibility testing tools such as axe-core and manual audits to identify and fix remaining issues.
subtasks.details: Use tools to scan for WCAG 2.2 AA compliance, verify fixes, and document accessibility improvements.

tasks.title: Setup Testing Suite and Performance Optimization
tasks.description: Implement comprehensive testing with Vitest and React Testing Library, optimize bundle size and performance
tasks.details:
1. Setup Vitest configuration: `npm install -D vitest @testing-library/react @testing-library/jest-dom jsdom`
2. Create test files for all major components and utilities
3. Implement unit tests for:
   - Context providers and hooks
   - API integration functions
   - Encryption/decryption utilities
   - Component rendering and interactions
4. Add integration tests for key user flows
5. Setup test coverage reporting
6. Optimize bundle size (target ≤100KB gzipped per route)
7. Implement code splitting and lazy loading
8. Add performance monitoring with Core Web Vitals
9. Optimize images and assets
10. Setup pre-commit hooks for testing
tasks.testStrategy: Achieve >80% test coverage, verify all critical paths are tested, performance budgets met, bundle size targets achieved

subtasks.title: Setup Vitest and Testing Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install Vitest, React Testing Library, Jest DOM matchers, user-event, and jsdom for browser environment simulation.
subtasks.details: Run npm install commands to add vitest, @testing-library/react, @testing-library/jest-dom, @testing-library/user-event, and jsdom as dev dependencies. This prepares the project for testing React components with Vitest and simulates a DOM environment for tests[1][2][3].

subtasks.title: Configure Vitest
subtasks.description: Create or update vitest.config.ts to configure Vitest with React plugin, jsdom environment, global test APIs, and setup files.
subtasks.details: Configure Vitest to use the React plugin, set test environment to 'jsdom', enable globals for test functions, and specify a setup file for additional test configurations[1][3].

subtasks.title: Create Test Setup File
subtasks.description: Create a setupTests.ts file to configure Jest DOM matchers and cleanup after each test.
subtasks.details: In the setupTests.ts file, import '@testing-library/jest-dom' to add custom matchers and configure cleanup after each test to avoid side effects[1][3].

subtasks.title: Create Test Files for Components and Utilities
subtasks.description: Create test files covering all major React components, context providers, hooks, API integration functions, and encryption utilities.
subtasks.details: Write test files for components and utilities to ensure coverage of rendering, interactions, state management, API calls, and encryption/decryption logic as per project requirements.

subtasks.title: Implement Unit Tests
subtasks.description: Develop unit tests for context providers, hooks, API integration functions, encryption/decryption utilities, and component rendering/interactions.
subtasks.details: Write focused unit tests to verify individual functions and components behave correctly in isolation, including state updates and UI behavior[1].

subtasks.title: Implement Integration Tests
subtasks.description: Add integration tests to cover key user flows and interactions across multiple components and modules.
subtasks.details: Develop tests that simulate real user scenarios involving multiple components and API interactions to ensure the system works as expected end-to-end[1].

subtasks.title: Setup Test Coverage Reporting
subtasks.description: Configure Vitest to generate test coverage reports and verify coverage thresholds are met.
subtasks.details: Enable coverage reporting in Vitest configuration and ensure reports show coverage metrics for statements, branches, functions, and lines, targeting >80% coverage[1].

subtasks.title: Optimize Bundle Size
subtasks.description: Analyze and optimize the JavaScript bundle size to meet target size constraints (≤100KB gzipped per route).
subtasks.details: Use tools like Vite bundle analyzer to identify large dependencies and optimize imports, remove unused code, and apply tree shaking to reduce bundle size.

subtasks.title: Implement Code Splitting and Performance Monitoring
subtasks.description: Apply code splitting strategies and set up performance monitoring to improve load times and runtime efficiency.
subtasks.details: Configure dynamic imports and route-based code splitting in the build process. Integrate performance monitoring tools to track runtime metrics and identify bottlenecks.

subtasks.title: Implement Image Optimization and Pre-commit Hooks
subtasks.description: Optimize images for web delivery and set up pre-commit hooks to enforce code quality and run tests before commits.
subtasks.details: Use image optimization tools or loaders to compress and resize images. Configure pre-commit hooks with tools like Husky to run linting, tests, and formatting checks automatically.
